DynamicChart.name: DynamicChart
DynamicChart.description:
Module DynamicChart

        This module requires:
        
        {{#crossLinkModule "chart_utils.js"}}{{/crossLinkModule}}
        {{#crossLink "http://d3js.org/d3.v2.js"}}{{/crossLink}} 

        Exposes methods for creating different types of dynamic charts:
        * BasicBarChart
        * FixedWidthBarChart
        * SlidingBarChart
        * TimeWheelChart

classitems.description: module ChartUtils

Creates and returns a safe proxy for the object passed
                                                    that will wrap around it and expose only those methods
                                                    that are declared as enumerable.

params.name: CanDestroy
params.description:
States if the proxy consumer has the authority to call destroy 
                                                                     on the original object

return.description: A proxy wrapping this object;

throws: Any exception the original object pseudo-constructor might throw.

classitems.description: Creates a new array (shallow) copying the elements of the current one

params.name: n:
params.description:
[Optional]
            If defined, the max number of elements to copy from the current array

classitems.description: Takes a value and a positive integer and returns an Array of n copies of that value

params.name: value:
params.description:
[Mandatory]
                The value to assign to each element of the newly created array.
                If value is a function, it is called  n times, with no parameters

params.name: n:
params.description:
[Mandatory]
            The size of the final array;
                WARNING:   since shallow copy is used, only works for
                                                primitive (immutable) values

classitems.description:
Format a hours, minutes couple into a proper time string
INVARIANT: HH and MM are valid, positive integers
           If the overcome their range, proper formatting is enforced:
           F.i. 23,60 -> "00:00"

params.name: HH:
params.description:
[Mandatory]
            An int value (between 0 and 23), representing the hours

params.name: MM:
params.description:
[Mandatory]
            An int value (between 0 and 59), representing the minutes

return.description:
:    - An array with two integers, the values for hours and minutes
                <=> The string validates successfully
            - null <-> Otherwise

classitems.description:
Takes a string as input and checks if it is a valid
time representation, according to the format HH:MM

params.name: timeString:
params.description:
[Mandatory]
                    The string to be evaluated

return.description:
:    - An array with two integers, the values for hours and minutes
                <=> The string validates successfully
            - null <-> Otherwise

classitems.description:
Takes two strings as input and checks if they are valid
time representations, according to the format HH:MM
If it is so, sums them and returns a new string representing
the resulting time;

params.name: timeString_1:
params.description:
[Mandatory]
                        The first time string to be added

params.name: timeString_2:
params.description:
[Mandatory]
                        The second time string to be added

return.description:
:    - A string representation of the sum of the two timeStamps, in the format HH:MM (modulo 24 hours)
                <=> Both strings validates successfully

throws:
:     
            - Invalid Argument Exception
if either input fails to validate

classitems.description:
Takes a string and an int value and checks if it is a valid
time representation, according to the format HH:MM

params.name: timeString:
params.description:
[Mandatory]
                      The time string taken as initial time

params.name: minutes:
params.description:
[Mandatory]
                    Minutes to be added to the time string

return.description:
:    - A string representation of the sum of the two time values, in the format HH:MM (modulo 24 hours)
                <=> Both inputs validates successfully

throws:
:     
            - Invalid Argument Exception
if either input fails to validate

classitems.description: Maximum dimension of the input space, i.e. max number of subvalues for each single point
classitems.name: MAX_SPACE_DIMENSION

classitems.description: Default fill colors bor graphic elements;
classitems.name: FILL_COLORS

classitems.description: Default size for chart's labels (in points);
classitems.name: DEFAULT_LABEL_SIZE

classitems.description: Default size for chart's title text (in points);
classitems.name: DEFAULT_TITLE_SIZE

classitems.description: Default width for legend's item boxes (in pixel);
classitems.name: LEGEND_ITEM_WIDTH

classitems.description: Default height for legend's item boxes (in pixel);
classitems.name: LEGEND_ITEM_HEIGHT

classitems.description: Default margin for legends (in pixel);
classitems.name: LEGEND_MARGIN

classitems.description: Default left margin for legend's items (in pixel);
classitems.name: LEGEND_ITEM_LEFT

classitems.description: Default font size for labels attached to legend's items (in pixel);
classitems.name: LEGEND_ITEM_FONT_SIZE

classitems.description: Sets the position of the legend in the page. Position is assumed to be absolute.
classitems.name: setPosition

params.name: left
top

return.description: This legend object, to allow for method chaining.

throws: Never: if either argument is not valid
simply ignores the action.

classitems.description: Sets the width of the legend bounding box.
classitems.name: setWidth

params.name: width
params.description:
[Mandatory]
                        The new width of the legend;
                        Only positive integers and values that can be converted
                        to positive Integers are accepted.

return.description: This legend object, to allow for method chaining.

throws: {Illegal Argument Exception} if the argument is not valid (see above).

classitems.description: Sets the height of the legend bounding box.
classitems.name: setHeight

params.name: height
params.description:
[Mandatory]
                        The new height of the legend; 
                        Only positive Integers and values that can be converted
                        to positive integers are accepted.

return.description: This legend object, to allow for method chaining.

throws:
<ul>
            <li> Illegal Argument Exception
if the argument is not valid (see above).

classitems.description: Adds an item to the legend and then redraws it;
classitems.name: addItem

params.name: labelText
params.description:
[Mandatory]
                            The text of the label for this new item;

params.name: labelColor
params.description:
[Mandatory]
                            The color to be used to draw new item's label;

params.name: fillColor
params.description:
[Mandatory]
                            The color associated with this new item;

return.description: This legend object, to allow for method chaining;

throws:
<ul>
            <li> Wrong Number of arguments Exception
if either argument is missing.

classitems.name: removeItem

params.name: index
params.description:
[Mandatory] 
                        The index of the item to update; 
                        Only positive Integers and values that can be converted
                        to positive integers are accepted.

return.description: This legend object, to allow for method chaining;

throws:
<ul>
            <li>Illegal Argument Exception
if index is not in its valid range.

classitems.description: Updates the attributes of an item of the legend and then redraws it;
classitems.name: updateItem

params.name: index
params.description:
[Mandatory]
                                            The index of the item to update;

params.name: labelText
labelColor
fillColor

return.description: This legend object, to allow for method chaining;

throws: - Illegal Argument Exception
if index is not in its valid range.

classitems.description:
Object's destructor: helps garbage collector freeing memory, and removes legend's DOM elements. Object's destructor: helps garbage collector freeing memory, and removes chart DOM elements.

WARNING: calling destroy on an object will force any further reference to its attributes / methods to throw exceptions.

NOTE: This function should be override by any class inheriting from this object.
In order to properly work, any overriding destroyer should:
  1. Free any array specific to the object on which is called;
  2. Remove any event listener on chart objects;
  3. Call super object's destroy method.
classitems.name: destroy

return.description: to state that the object has been destroyed.

classitems.description:
[Private Object, only accessible to DynamicChart classes]

Creates, upon request, a new Legend object and returns it;
classitems.name: LegendFactory

params.name: width
params.description: [Mandatory] The desired width for the chart (can't be changed later) Can be any value that is or can be converted to a positive integer.

params.name: height
params.description: [Mandatory] The desired height for the chart (can't be changed later) Can be any value that is or can be converted to a positive integer.

params.name: left
params.description:
[Optional]
                        The horizontal position of the legend bounding box;

params.name: top
params.description:
[Optional]
                        The vertical position of the legend bounding box;

params.name: [parent=
params.description:
page's body element]   [Optional]
                        The DOM element to which the diagram should be appended as a child

return.description: A new Legend object;

throws: -   Wrong number of arguments Exception

if width or height are not passed as arguments (directly)
        -   Illegal Argument exception
if width or height aren't valid (numeric

positive) values 
            (through setWidth or setHeight)
        -   Illegal Argument exception

if dataDim is passed but it's invalid (not numeric or not positive)
        -   Exception

if dataDim exceeds the maximum data dimension
        -   Exception
if parent is passed but it is not a valid DOM element

classitems.description: [Private method, not visible from consumers]
classitems.name: __init__

params.name: legend
params.description:
[Mandatory]
                The legend object to be initialized;

params.name: width
params.description:
[Mandatory]
                The width of the legend object;

params.name: height
params.description:
[Mandatory]
                The height of the legend object;

throws: -   Illegal Argument exception
if width or height aren't valid (numeric

positive) values 
                (through setWidth or setHeight)

classitems.description:
[Protected method, not visible outside this library]

Update the drawings of this legend object;
classitems.name: __redrawLegend__
throws: -   Illegal Argument exception
if width or height aren't valid (numeric

positive) values 
                (through setWidth or setHeight)

classitems.description: The div element that will be a container to the legend's svg element
classitems.name: __divElement__

classitems.description: The svg element for this Legend
classitems.name: __svgElement__

classitems.description: Array of the items contained in the legend
classitems.name: __items__

classitems.description: Sets the position of the chart in the page. Position is assumed to be absolute.
classitems.name: setPosition

params.name: left
params.description:
[Mandatory]
                        The horizontal position of the chart bounding box;

params.name: top
params.description:
[Mandatory]
                        The vertical position of the chart bounding box;

return.description: This chart object, to allow for method chaining.

throws: Never: if either argument is not valid
simply ignores the action.

classitems.description: Sets the width of the chart bounding box.
classitems.name: setWidth

params.name: width
params.description:
[Mandatory] The new width of the chart;
Only positive integers and values that can be converted to positive Integers are accepted.

return.description: This chart object, to allow for method chaining.

throws: {Illegal Argument Exception} if the argument is not valid (see above).

classitems.description: Sets the height of the chart bounding box.
classitems.name: setHeight

params.name: height
params.description:
[Mandatory] The new height of the chart;
Only positive Integers and values that can be converted to positive integers are accepted.

return.description: This chart object, to allow for method chaining.

throws:
<ul>
            <li> Illegal Argument Exception
if the argument is not valid (see above).

classitems.description: Sets the title for the chart, including all its attributes.
classitems.name: setTitle

params.name: title
params.description:
[Mandatory]
                        The new title for the chart;

params.name: [size=DEFAULT
params.description:
TITLE SIZE] [Optional] The size of the new title;
Only positive Integers and values that can be converted to positive integers are accepted.

params.name: color
params.description: [Optional] The color of the new title;

params.name: left
params.description:
[Optional] The horizontal position of the title, relative to the chart; the text will be centered around this point
Only positive Integers and values that can be converted to positive integers are accepted.

params.name: top
params.description:
[Optional] The vertical position of the title, relative to the chart;
Only positive Integers and values that can be converted to positive integers are accepted.

return.description: This legend object, to allow for method chaining.

throws:
<ul>
            <li> Illegal Argument Exception
if the argument is not valid (see above).

classitems.description: Insert new data into the chart, at runtime;
classitems.name: addLegend

params.name: labels
params.description:
[Mandatory] An array containing exactly one label for each component of the data space.
A new legend object will be created and attached to the chart, and then for every subcomponent [label] a new item will be added to the legend.

return.description: This chart object, to support method chaining;

throws:
-   Illegal Argument Exception: if labels isn't an Array object.
                                    -   Invalid array size Exception:   if the number of elements in the array is different
                                                                        from the number of subcomponents of the data space
                                                                        (i.e. from the __dataDim__ attribute)

classitems.description: Insert new data into the chart, at runtime;
classitems.name: appendData

params.name: newDataArray
params.description:
[Mandatory] An array containing the next values that needs to be drawn in the chart;
Each array element, in order to be added to the chart, must be compliant with the data format defined by the function __formatData__ (which can itself be set at runtime, and by default accepts arrays of __dataDim__ integers, neglecting to render the negative ones).

return.description: This chart object, to support method chaining;

throws: -   Illegal Argument Exception: if newDataArray isn't an Array object.

classitems.description:
Change the data formatting function, allowing to pass a custom handler
                            to cope with JSON or other data formats.
classitems.name: setFormatValueFunction

params.name: formaValueFunction
params.description:
[Mandatory] 
                                                                 The new data formatting/parsing function;

return.description: This object, to allow for method chaining;

throws: - Illegal Argument Exception
if the argument passed isn't a valid function.

classitems.description: Remove all the data, or part of it, from the chart;
classitems.name: clearData

params.name: n

return.description: This object, to allow for method chaining;

throws: Illegal Argument Exception
if n is passed but it isn't valid
i.e. it isn't convertible to a positive int.

classitems.description: Toggles the visibility of labels in the chart
classitems.name: toggleLabels

params.name: index
visible
params.description:
[Optional]
                If specified overwrites toggle behaviour and set
												the visibility to visible.

return.description: This chart object, to allow for method chaining

throws: - Invalid Index Exception:   if the index specified isn't valid.

classitems.description: Checks if labels for the index-th dimension are visible
classitems.name: areLabelsVisible

params.name: index

return.description: The visibility of the label

throws: Invalid Index Exception:   if the index specified isn't valid.

classitems.description:
Sets scaling to global

When data space has a dimension greater than 1 (i.e. when each data value has more than 1 component) these charts support either global scaling (relative to the whole dataset) or local scaling (relative to value of the same component) of each subcomponent.
classitems.name: setGlobalScaling

return.description: This chart object, to allow for method chaining.

classitems.description:
Sets scaling to local

When data space has a dimension greater than 1 (i.e. when each data value has more than 1 component) these charts support either global scaling (relative to the whole dataset) or local scaling (relative to value of the same component) of each subcomponent.
classitems.name: setLocalScaling

return.description: This chart object, to allow for method chaining.

classitems.description: Gets the fill color used to draw the index-th component of the data space.
classitems.name: getFillColor

params.name: index

return.description: The selected fill color.

throws: - Invalid Index Exception:   if the index specified isn't valid.

classitems.description: Gets the stroke color used to draw the index-th component of the data space.
classitems.name: getStrokeColor

params.name: index

return.description: The selected stroke color.

throws: - Invalid Index Exception:   if the index specified isn't valid.

classitems.description: Gets the fill color used for the labels attached to the index-th component of the data space.
classitems.name: getLabelColor

params.name: index

return.description: The selected label color.

throws: - Invalid Index Exception:   if the index specified isn't valid.

classitems.description: Gets the size used for the labels attached to the index-th component of the data space.
classitems.name: getLabelsSize

params.name: index

return.description: The selected size.

throws: - Invalid Index Exception:   if the index specified isn't valid.

classitems.description: Sets the fill color used to draw the index-th component of the data space.
classitems.name: setFillColor

params.name: {String|Object]
params.description:
color   [Mandatory]
                                                The new fill color for the selected component's;

params.name: index

return.description: This chart object, to allow for method chaining.

throws: - Invalid Index Exception:   if the index specified isn't valid;

classitems.description: Sets the stroke color used to draw the index-th component of the data space.
classitems.name: setStrokeColor

params.name: color
params.description:
[Mandatory]
                                                The new stroke color for the selected component's;

params.name: index

return.description: This chart object, to allow for method chaining.

throws: - Invalid Index Exception:   if the index specified isn't valid;

classitems.description: Sets the fill color used for the labels attached to the index-th component of the data space.
classitems.name: setLabelColor

params.name: color
params.description:
[Mandatory]
                                                The new color for the selected component's labels;

params.name: index

return.description: This chart object, to allow for method chaining.

throws: - Invalid Index Exception:   if the index specified isn't valid;

classitems.description: Sets the size used for the labels attached to the index-th component of the data space.
classitems.name: setLabelSize

params.name: size
index

return.description: This chart object, to allow for method chaining.

throws:
- Invalid Index Exception:   if the index specified isn't valid;
                                            - Illegal Argument Exception:   if size isn't valid (see above).

classitems.description:
Sets the bars width property; For this chart, bar width is computed at runtime according to the number of bars plotted, so this property can't be set.
Unless overridden, any call to this method will cause an exception to be thrown
This method is declared to improve the consistency of the interface.
classitems.name: setBarWidth
throws: Read only property Exception

classitems.description:
Gets the current bar width for this chart;
                                For this chart, bar width is computed at runtime according to the number of bars plotted;
classitems.name: getBarWidth

params.name: xScale
params.description:
[Optional] It is possible to pass a d3 scale object to get the bar width computed with respect to a different scale metric;
On default, the value is computed with respect to this chart's current metric.

return.description: The value computed for the bar width under current object state.

throws: - Illegal Argument Exception:   if an invalid xScale object is passed.

classitems.description:
Object's destructor: helps garbage collector freeing memory, and removes chart DOM elements.

WARNING: calling destroy on an object will force any further reference to its attributes / methods to throw exceptions.

NOTE: This function should be override by any class inheriting from this chart.
In order to properly work, any overriding destroyer should:
  1. Free any array specific to the object on which is called;
  2. Remove any event listener on chart objects;
  3. Call super object's destroy method.
classitems.name: destroy

return.description: to state that the object has been destroyed.

classitems.description: Utility function to take account of the number of points currently added to the chart
classitems.name: __getDatasetLength__

return.description: How many points are stored in the dataset right now.

classitems.description:
Checks that new data can be added to the chart (if the chart can represent only a limited number of points);

WARNING: This function SHOULD be overriden in any class inheriting from the base class in order to handle differents needs
classitems.name: __canAppendData__

params.name: newDataArray
params.description:
[Mandatory]
                                                            The array of values that should be added;

return.description:
The array of values that can still be added to the chart;
If no other value can be added, return the empty list.

classitems.name: __formatValue__

params.name: value
params.description:
[Mandatory]
                                                                    The value to be tested;

return.description:
• An array with properly formatted values, each of whom converted to float <=> value is correctly validated
  • null <-> Otherwise

classitems.description:
Returns the list of the svg elements used to represent data subcomponents with the required index.
I.e.: if data space is 3-dimensional (i.e. every point has 3 components) __selectData__(data, 2) would select the svg elements representing the 2nd component of every point in data
classitems.name: __selectData__

params.name: data
params.description:
[Mandatory]
                                                        The dataset on which selection should be applied

params.name: index
params.description:
[Mandatory] The index of the required component
INVARIANT: to avoid defensive programming, it is assumed 0 <= index < this.__dataDim__

params.name: n
params.description:
[Optional]
                                                    The maximum number of elements to return;

return.description: The proper set of d3 elements.

classitems.description:
Returns the list of the svg elements used to draw the labels of subcomponents of data with the required index.
I.e.: if data space is 3-dimensional (i.e. every point has 3 components) __selectLabels__(data, 3) would select the svg elements representing the labels of the 3nd component of every point in data
classitems.name: __selectLabels__

params.name: data
params.description:
[Mandatory]
                                                    The dataset on which selection should be applied;

params.name: index
params.description:
[Mandatory] The index of the required component;
INVARIANT: to avoid defensive programming, it is assumed 0 <= index < this.__dataDim__

params.name: n
params.description:
[Optional]
                                                    The maximum number of elements to return;

return.description: The proper set of d3 elements.

classitems.description:
Called by appendData() to draw the newly added points in dataSet, once for every data subcomponent.

WARNING: if you inherit from this class you might want to override both this method and __updateDrawing__ in order to obtain a custom chart.
classitems.name: __drawNewData__

params.name: dataSet
params.description:
[Mandatory] The set of svg elements created so far to represent the data;
WARNING: this parameter should be generated by an appropriate call to __selectData__;

params.name: labelsSet
params.description:
[Mandatory] The set of svg elements created so far to represent the labels of the data;
WARNING: this parameter should be generated by an appropriate call to __selectLabels__;

params.name: dataIndex
params.description:
[Mandatory]
                                                                The index of the component of the data which is to be drawn;

params.name: xScale
params.description:
[Mandatory]
                                                    D3 scale object for X axis;

params.name: yScale
params.description:
[Mandatory]
                                                    D3 scale object for Y axis (specific to current component);

classitems.description:
Called by appendData() to update drawing of the points in dataSet, once for every data subcomponent.
After new data is inserted by __drawNewData__, appendData performs adjustments to accomodate for scale change or shift in the drawing due to time, and this function takes care of updating and fixing the chart representation.

WARNING: if you inherit from this class you might want to override both this method and __drawNewData__ in order to obtain a custom chart.
classitems.name: __updateDrawing__

params.name: dataSet
params.description:
[Mandatory] The set of svg elements created so far to represent the data;
WARNING: this parameter should be generated by an appropriate call to __selectData__;

params.name: labelsSet
params.description:
[Mandatory] The set of svg elements created so far to represent the labels of the data;
WARNING: this parameter should be generated by an appropriate call to __selectLabels__;

params.name: dataIndex
params.description:
[Mandatory]
                                                        The index of the component of the data which is to be drawn;

params.name: xScale
params.description:
[Mandatory]
                                                            D3 scale object for X axis;

params.name: yScale
params.description:
[Mandatory]
                                                            D3 scale object for Y axis (specific to current component).

classitems.description:
Takes care of the remaining details related to the removal of part of the values from the chart, based on to the particular chart needs.

WARNING: Inherited objects MIGHT NEED to override this function.
classitems.name: __onClearData__

params.name: n
params.description:
[Mandatory]
                                                          Must be a positive Integer, or a value that
                                                          can be converted to a positive Integer;
                                                          Number of elements removed from the chart

classitems.description: Removes the svg objects related to the data cleared by the caller (clearData).
classitems.name: __clearDrawing__

params.name: dataSet
params.description:
[Mandatory]
                                                            List of drawing objects (default: rects) representing data

params.name: labelsSet
params.description:
[Mandatory]
                                                                List of labels related to data removed

classitems.description:
Computes and return the suggested value for the opacity of the bar
                                drawn to represent a certain value.
classitems.name: __getBarOpacity__

params.name: val
params.description:
[Mandatory] The value to be represented;
Accepts only normalized values (scaled between 0 and 1).
INVARIANT: to avoid defensive programming, it is assumed 0 <= val <=1

return.description: The opacity to apply to the value representation in the chart.

classitems.description:
Basic bar histogram chart.
            Values are represented using vertical bars;
            Each point or value can have up to 10 subcomponents, where each component can be 
            any non-nregative real number (i.e., each point can be in R_+^i, for 1 <= i <= 10).
classitems.name: BasicBarChart

params.name: width
params.description:
[Mandatory] The desired width for the chart (can't be changed later)
Can be any value that is or can be converted to a positive integer.

params.name: height
params.description:
[Mandatory] The desired height for the chart (can't be changed later)
Can be any value that is or can be converted to a positive integer.

params.name: dataDim
params.description:
[Optional] The dimension of the data space, i.e. the number of subvalues for each data entry
Can be any value that is or can be converted to an integer between 1 and MAX_SPACE_DIMENSION.

params.name: parent
params.description:
[Optional]
                            The DOM element to which the diagram should be appended as a child

return.description: A new BasicBarChart object

throws: -   Wrong number of arguments Exception

if width or height are not passed as arguments (directly)
                                -   Illegal Argument exception
if width or height aren't valid (numeric

positive) values 
                                    (through setWidth or setHeight)
                                -   Illegal Argument exception

if dataDim is passed but it's invalid (not numeric or not positive)
                                -   Exception

if dataDim exceeds the maximum data dimension
                                -   Exception
if parent is passed but it is not a valid DOM element

classitems.tagname:
[Private method]

Inits the chart DIV and SVG container, setting width and height, if they are passed as arguments;

params.name: chart:
params.description:
[Mandatory]
                The chart object that needs initialization;

params.name: width:
params.description:
[Optional]
                The desired width for the chart;
                If passed, MUST be a positive integer, or a value that
                can be converted to a positive integer

params.name: height:
params.description:
[Optional]
                The desired height for the chart;
                If passed, MUST be a positive integer, or a value that
                can be converted to a positive intege

return.description: :    Nothing;

throws: - Inconsitent Chart State Exception

if the internale state of the object is compromised;
            - Illegal Argument Exception
through setWidth or setHeight

if one of the arguments is
                not valid.

classitems.description: Performs all the settings related to the data handling area of the chart;
classitems.name: __initData__

params.name: basicCharObj
params.description:
[Mandatory]
                                             The chart object to init;

params.name: dataDim
params.description:
[Optional] The dimension of the data space, i.e. the number of subvalues for each data entry;
Can take any value that is or can be converted to an integer between 1 and MAX_SPACE_DIMENSION.

throws: -   Illegal Argument exception

if dataDim is passed but it's 
                                        not valid (not numeric or not positive)
                                    -   Exception
if dataDim exceeds the maximum data dimension

classitems.description:
Dimension of the data space, 
i.e. number of subcomponents of each data "point"
classitems.name: __dataDim__

classitems.description:
The array that will hold data, separately for each component
Initially every component's array is set to []
classitems.name: __data__

classitems.description: Array of maximum values for each component (used to compute the vertical scale)
classitems.name: __maxVals__

classitems.description: The parent object to whom the chart is added
classitems.name: __parent__

classitems.description: The div element that will be a container to the chart's svg element
classitems.name: __divElement__

classitems.description: The chart's svg element
classitems.name: __svgElement__

classitems.description:
Scale object for the horizontal axis of the chart 
(common to all data subcomponents)
classitems.name: __xScale__

classitems.description:
Scale objects for the vertical axis of the chart 
(array with one obj for each data subcomponents,
 so that each component can be scaled independently)
classitems.name: __yScale__

classitems.description:
For data space with dimension gt 1, states
if the different components should scale locally or globally
classitems.name: __scaleGlobally__

classitems.description:
For each data subcomponent, stores the size to be used
for its label
classitems.name: __labelsSize__

classitems.description:
For each data subcomponent, states whether or not
its label is visible
classitems.name: __labelsVisible__

classitems.description:
For each data subcomponent, stores the color to be used
to fill its drawing component
classitems.name: __labelsVisible__

classitems.description:
For each data subcomponent, stores the color to be used
for the stroke of its drawing component
classitems.name: __strokeColors__

classitems.description:
For each data subcomponent, stores the color to be used
to draw its labels
classitems.name: __labelColors__

classitems.description:
Placeholder for a possible legend object, if the consumer
decides to add a legend to the chart;
classitems.name: __legend__

classitems.description:
Advanced Chart: FixedWidthBarChart
            Inherits from BasicBarChart redefining the drawing methods.
            As for its super class values are represented using vertical bars, and each point 
            can have up to 10 subcomponents, where each component can be any non-negative 
            real number (i.e., each point can be in R_+^i, for 1 <= i <= 10).
For this chart the bar width is fixed (although can be set at run time)
            It is possible to choose between having only a fixed number of values accepted,
            or if a certain number of the oldest values should be removed when the
            chart is full.
classitems.name: FixedWidthBarChart

params.name: ticks
params.description:
[Mandatory] The number of values that can be drawn at the same time (can't be changed later)
Can be any value that is or can be converted to a positive integer.

params.name: startingPoint
width
params.description:
[Mandatory] The desired width for the chart (can't be changed later)
Can be any value that is or can be converted to a positive integer.

params.name: height
params.description:
[Mandatory] The desired height for the chart (can't be changed later)
Can be any value that is or can be converted to a positive integer.

params.name: dataDim
params.description:
[Optional] The dimension of the data space, i.e. the number of subvalues for each data entry
Can be any value that is or can be converted to an integer between 1 and MAX_SPACE_DIMENSION.

params.name: parent
params.description:
[Optional]
                            The DOM element to which the diagram should be appended as a child

return.description: :    A new FixedWidthBarChart object

throws: -   Illegal Argument Exception

if ticks isn't a positive integer
                                -   Wrong number of arguments Exception

if width or height are not passed as arguments (directly)
                                -   Illegal Argument Exception
if width or height aren't valid (numeric

positive) values 
                                    (through setWidth or setHeight)
                                -   Illegal Argument Exception

if dataDim is passed but it's invalid (not numeric or not positive)
                                -   Exception

if dataDim exceeds the maximum data dimension
                                -   Exception

if the ratio between chart's width and number of ticks is such
                                    that the computed bar height is smaller than 1 pixel
                                -   Exception
if parent is passed but it is not a valid DOM element

classitems.description: drawn at the same time in this chart
[Defaults to 1]

new plots would override previous ones.
Two solutions are made available:
1)  By default, new data is rejected, generating a full stack exception;
2)  A certain number of the oldest data points can be purged off the chart,
    counter-clockwise rotating the data

Sets fixed data length mode.
                                                
                                                When __ticks__ data points have already been plotted,
                                                new plots would override previous ones.
                                                Two solutions are made available:
                                                1)  By default, new data is rejected, generating a full stack exception;
                                                2)  A certain number of the oldest data points can be purged off the chart,
                                                    counter-clockwise rotating the data
                                                    
                                                This function sets the first option.

return.description: :    This chart object, to allow for methd chaining.

classitems.description:
Sets data shift mode.
                                                
                                                When __ticks__ data points have already been plotted,
                                                new plots would override previous ones.
                                                Two solutions are made available:
                                                1)  By default, new data is rejected, generating a full stack exception;
                                                2)  A certain number of the oldest data points can be purged off the chart,
                                                    shifting back (left) the remaining data.
                                                    
                                                This function sets the second option.

params.name: ticksToRemove:
params.description:
[Mandatory]
                                                                      How much data to remove on full chart;

return.description: :    This object, to allow for method chaining;

throws: Illegal Argument Exception
if the argument isn't valid (see above).

classitems.description:
Returns current bars' width.
                                                The overridden version takes a parameter, but this method
                                                doesn't need it because barWidth is fixed for this chart.

return.description: : the value set for __barWidth__;

params.description:
[Mandatory]
                Chart's height;

return.description: : Nothing

classitems.extends:
{FixedWidthBarChart}

Advanced Chart: SlidingBarChart
Inherits from FixedWidthBarChart redefining the drawing methods.
As for its super class values are represented using vertical bars, and each point 
can have up to 10 subcomponents, where each component can be any non-negative 
real number (i.e., each point can be in R_+^i, for 1 <= i <= 10).

For this chart the bar width is fixed (although can be set at run time)
It is possible to choose between having only a fixed number of values accepted,
or if a certain number of the oldest values should be removed when the
chart is full.

Every __ticksBetweenHighlights__ values inserted (where __ticksBetweenHighlights__ can 
be set at runtime, although it defaults to 10) the background of those values is highlighted, 
to stress out time progression.

params.name: ticks
params.description:
[Mandatory] The number of values that can be drawn at the same time (can't be changed later)
Can be any value that is or can be converted to a positive integer.

params.name: width
params.description:
[Mandatory] The desired width for the chart (can't be changed later)
Can be any value that is or can be converted to a positive integer.

params.name: height
params.description:
[Mandatory] The desired height for the chart (can't be changed later)
Can be any value that is or can be converted to a positive integer.

params.name: dataDim
params.description:
[Optional] The dimension of the data space, i.e. the number of subvalues for each data entry
Can be any value that is or can be converted to an integer between 1 and MAX_SPACE_DIMENSION.

params.name: parent
params.description:
[Optional]
                The DOM element to which the diagram should be appended as a child

return.description: A new SlidingBarChart object

throws: -   Illegal Argument Exception

if ticks isn't a positive integer
                    -   Wrong number of arguments Exception

if width or height are not passed as arguments (directly)
                    -   Illegal Argument Exception
if width or height aren't valid (numeric

positive) values 
                        (through setWidth or setHeight)
                    -   Illegal Argument Exception

if dataDim is passed but it's invalid (not numeric or not positive)
                    -   Exception

if dataDim exceeds the maximum data dimension
                    -   Exception

if the ratio between chart's width and number of ticks is such
                        that the computed bar height is smaller than 1 pixel
                    -   Exception
if parent is passed but it is not a valid DOM element

classitems.extends:
FixedWidthBarChart

Advanced Chart: TimeWheelChart
Inherits from BasicBarChart redefining the drawing methods.

Data is represented as bars drawn around a time wheel.

It is possible to choose between having only a fixed number of values accepted,
or if a certain number of the oldest values should be removed when the
chart is full.

params.name: ticks
params.description:
[Mandatory] The number of values that can be drawn at the same time (can't be changed later)
Can be any value that is or can be converted to a positive integer.

params.name: startTime
params.description:
[Mandatory] The reference for the label of the first point.
Should be an incrementable value.

params.name: width
params.description:
[Mandatory] The desired width for the chart (can't be changed later)
Can be any value that is or can be converted to a positive integer.

params.name: height!~YUIDOC_LINE~!
params.description:
[Mandatory] The desired height for the chart (can't be changed later)
Can be any value that is or can be converted to a positive integer.

params.description:
[Optional] The dimension of the data space, i.e. the number of subvalues for each data entry;
Can be any value that is or can be converted to an integer between 1 and MAX_SPACE_DIMENSION.

params.description:
[Optional]
                The DOM element to which the diagram should be appended as a child

positive) values

                    -   Exception

classitems.description: Object's destructor: helps garbage collector freeing memory, and removes chart DOM elements. WARNING: calling destroy on an object will force any further reference to its attributes / methods to throw exceptions. NOTE: This function should be override by any class inheriting from this chart. In order to properly work, any overriding destroyer should: - Free any array specific to the object on which is called; - Remove any event listener on chart objects; - Call super object's destroy method.

return.description: :    null, to state that the object has been destroyed.

warnings.message:
Missing item type
Creates and returns a safe proxy for the object passed
                                                    that will wrap around it and expose only those methods
                                                    that are declared as enumerable.

Missing item type
Creates a new array (shallow) copying the elements of the current one

Missing item type
Takes a value and a positive integer and returns an Array of n copies of that value

Missing item type
Format a hours, minutes couple into a proper time string
INVARIANT: HH and MM are valid, positive integers
           If the overcome their range, proper formatting is enforced:
           F.i. 23,60 -> "00:00"

Missing item type
Takes a string as input and checks if it is a valid
time representation, according to the format HH:MM

Missing item type
Takes two strings as input and checks if they are valid
time representations, according to the format HH:MM
If it is so, sums them and returns a new string representing
the resulting time;

Missing item type
Takes a string and an int value and checks if it is a valid
time representation, according to the format HH:MM
